Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/add1sp.c

1/* mpfr_add1sp -- internal function to perform a "real" addition
2 All the op must have the same precision
3
4Copyright 2004-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
5Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
6
7This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
8
9The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
10it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
11the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
12option) any later version.
13
14The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
15WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
16or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
17License for more details.
18
19You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
20along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
21http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2251 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
23
24#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
25#include "mpfr-impl.h"
26
27/* Check if we have to check the result of mpfr_add1sp with mpfr_add1 */
28#if MPFR_WANT_ASSERT >= 2
29
30int mpfr_add1sp_ref (mpfr_ptr, mpfr_srcptr, mpfr_srcptr, mpfr_rnd_t);
31int mpfr_add1sp (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
32{
33 mpfr_t tmpa, tmpb, tmpc, tmpd;
34 mpfr_flags_t old_flags, flags, flags2;
35 int inexb, inexc, inexact, inexact2;
36
37 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
38 return mpfr_add1sp_ref (a, b, c, rnd_mode);
39
40 old_flags = __gmpfr_flags;
41
42 mpfr_init2 (tmpa, MPFR_PREC (a));
43 mpfr_init2 (tmpb, MPFR_PREC (b));
44 mpfr_init2 (tmpc, MPFR_PREC (c));
45
46 inexb = mpfr_set (tmpb, b, MPFR_RNDN);
47 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexb == 0);
48
49 inexc = mpfr_set (tmpc, c, MPFR_RNDN);
50 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexc == 0);
51
52 MPFR_ASSERTN (__gmpfr_flags == old_flags);
53
54 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (tmpb) < MPFR_GET_EXP (tmpc))
55 {
56 /* The sign for the result will be taken from the second argument
57 (= first input value, which is tmpb). */
58 MPFR_ALIAS (tmpd, tmpc, MPFR_SIGN (tmpb), MPFR_EXP (tmpc));
59 inexact2 = mpfr_add1 (tmpa, tmpd, tmpb, rnd_mode);
60 }
61 else
62 {
63 inexact2 = mpfr_add1 (tmpa, tmpb, tmpc, rnd_mode);
64 }
65 flags2 = __gmpfr_flags;
66
67 __gmpfr_flags = old_flags;
68 inexact = mpfr_add1sp_ref (a, b, c, rnd_mode);
69 flags = __gmpfr_flags;
70
71 if (! mpfr_equal_p (tmpa, a) || inexact != inexact2 || flags != flags2)
72 {
73 fprintf (stderr, "add1 & add1sp return different values for %s\n"
74 "Prec_a = %lu, Prec_b = %lu, Prec_c = %lu\nB = ",
75 mpfr_print_rnd_mode (rnd_mode),
76 (unsigned long) MPFR_PREC (a),
77 (unsigned long) MPFR_PREC (b),
78 (unsigned long) MPFR_PREC (c));
79 mpfr_fdump (stderr, tmpb);
80 fprintf (stderr, "C = ");
81 mpfr_fdump (stderr, tmpc);
82 fprintf (stderr, "\nadd1 : ");
83 mpfr_fdump (stderr, tmpa);
84 fprintf (stderr, "add1sp: ");
85 mpfr_fdump (stderr, a);
86 fprintf (stderr, "Inexact sp = %d | Inexact = %d\n"
87 "Flags sp = %u | Flags = %u\n",
88 inexact, inexact2, flags, flags2);
89 MPFR_ASSERTN (0);
90 }
91 mpfr_clears (tmpa, tmpb, tmpc, (mpfr_ptr) 0);
92 return inexact;
93}
94# define mpfr_add1sp mpfr_add1sp_ref
95#endif /* MPFR_WANT_ASSERT >= 2 */
96
97#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI)
98
99/* same as mpfr_add1sp, but for p < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
100static int
101mpfr_add1sp1 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode,
102 mpfr_prec_t p)
103{
104 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
105 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
106 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
107 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
108 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
109 mpfr_prec_t sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
110 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
111 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
112 mp_limb_t a0; /* to store the result */
113 mp_limb_t mask;
114 mpfr_uexp_t d;
115
116 MPFR_ASSERTD(p < GMP_NUMB_BITS);
117
118 if (bx == cx)
119 {
120 /* The following line is probably better than
121 a0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | ((bp[0] + cp[0]) >> 1);
122 as it has less dependency and doesn't need a long constant on some
123 processors. On ARM, it can also probably benefit from shift-and-op
124 in a better way. Timings cannot be conclusive. */
125 a0 = (bp[0] >> 1) + (cp[0] >> 1);
126 bx ++;
127 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
128 ap[0] = a0 ^ rb;
129 sb = 0; /* since b + c fits on p+1 bits, the sticky bit is zero */
130 }
131 else if (bx > cx)
132 {
133 BGreater1:
134 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
135 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
136 /* TODO: Should the case d < sh be removed, i.e. seen as a particular
137 case of d < GMP_NUMB_BITS? This case would do a bit more operations
138 but a test would be removed, avoiding pipeline stall issues. */
139 if (d < sh)
140 {
141 /* we can shift c by d bits to the right without losing any bit,
142 moreover we can shift one more if there is an exponent increase */
143 a0 = bp[0] + (cp[0] >> d);
144 if (a0 < bp[0]) /* carry */
145 {
146 MPFR_ASSERTD ((a0 & 1) == 0);
147 a0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a0 >> 1);
148 bx ++;
149 }
150 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
151 sb = (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
152 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
153 }
154 else if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* sh <= d < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
155 {
156 sb = cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d); /* bits from cp[-1] after shift */
157 a0 = bp[0] + (cp[0] >> d);
158 if (a0 < bp[0]) /* carry */
159 {
160 sb |= a0 & 1;
161 a0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a0 >> 1);
162 bx ++;
163 }
164 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
165 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
166 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
167 }
168 else /* d >= GMP_NUMB_BITS */
169 {
170 ap[0] = bp[0];
171 rb = 0; /* since p < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
172 sb = 1; /* since c <> 0 */
173 }
174 }
175 else /* bx < cx: swap b and c */
176 {
177 mpfr_exp_t tx;
178 mp_limb_t *tp;
179 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
180 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
181 goto BGreater1;
182 }
183
184 /* Note: we could keep the output significand in a0 for the rounding,
185 and only store it in ap[0] at the very end, but this seems slower
186 on average (but better for the worst case). */
187
188 /* now perform rounding */
189 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx > __gmpfr_emax))
190 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
191
192 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
193 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
194 MPFR_RET(0);
195 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
196 {
197 /* the condition below should be rb == 0 || (rb != 0 && ...), but this
198 is equivalent to rb == 0 || (...) */
199 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
200 goto truncate;
201 else
202 goto add_one_ulp;
203 }
204 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
205 {
206 truncate:
207 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
208 }
209 else /* round away from zero */
210 {
211 add_one_ulp:
212 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
213 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[0] == 0))
214 {
215 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
216 /* no need to have MPFR_LIKELY here, since we are in a rare branch */
217 if (bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax)
218 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
219 else /* overflow */
220 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
221 }
222 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
223 }
224}
225
226/* same as mpfr_add1sp, but for p = GMP_NUMB_BITS */
227static int
228mpfr_add1sp1n (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
229{
230 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
231 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
232 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
233 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
234 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
235 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
236 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
237 mp_limb_t a0; /* to store the result */
238 mpfr_uexp_t d;
239
240 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC (a) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
241 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC (b) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
242 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC (c) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
243
244 if (bx == cx)
245 {
246 a0 = bp[0] + cp[0];
247 rb = a0 & MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
248 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a0 >> 1);
249 bx ++;
250 sb = 0; /* since b + c fits on p+1 bits, the sticky bit is zero */
251 }
252 else if (bx > cx)
253 {
254 BGreater1:
255 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
256 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* 1 <= d < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
257 {
258 a0 = bp[0] + (cp[0] >> d);
259 sb = cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d); /* bits from cp[-1] after shift */
260 if (a0 < bp[0]) /* carry */
261 {
262 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a0 >> 1);
263 rb = a0 & 1;
264 bx ++;
265 }
266 else /* no carry */
267 {
268 ap[0] = a0;
269 rb = sb & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
270 sb &= ~MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
271 }
272 }
273 else /* d >= GMP_NUMB_BITS */
274 {
275 sb = d != GMP_NUMB_BITS || cp[0] != MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
276 ap[0] = bp[0];
277 rb = d == GMP_NUMB_BITS;
278 }
279 }
280 else /* bx < cx: swap b and c */
281 {
282 mpfr_exp_t tx;
283 mp_limb_t *tp;
284 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
285 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
286 goto BGreater1;
287 }
288
289 /* Note: we could keep the output significand in a0 for the rounding,
290 and only store it in ap[0] at the very end, but this seems slower
291 on average (but better for the worst case). */
292
293 /* now perform rounding */
294 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx > __gmpfr_emax))
295 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
296
297 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
298 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
299 MPFR_RET(0);
300 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
301 {
302 /* the condition below should be rb == 0 || (rb != 0 && ...), but this
303 is equivalent to rb == 0 || (...) */
304 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & MPFR_LIMB_ONE) == 0))
305 goto truncate;
306 else
307 goto add_one_ulp;
308 }
309 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
310 {
311 truncate:
312 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
313 }
314 else /* round away from zero */
315 {
316 add_one_ulp:
317 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
318 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[0] == 0))
319 {
320 ap[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
321 /* no need to have MPFR_LIKELY here, since we are in a rare branch */
322 if (bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax)
323 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
324 else /* overflow */
325 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
326 }
327 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
328 }
329}
330
331/* same as mpfr_add1sp, but for GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
332static int
333mpfr_add1sp2 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode,
334 mpfr_prec_t p)
335{
336 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
337 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
338 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
339 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
340 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
341 mpfr_prec_t sh = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
342 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
343 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
344 mp_limb_t a1, a0;
345 mp_limb_t mask;
346 mpfr_uexp_t d;
347
348 MPFR_ASSERTD(GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS);
349
350 if (bx == cx)
351 {
352 /* since bp[1], cp[1] >= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT, a carry always occurs */
353 a0 = bp[0] + cp[0];
354 a1 = bp[1] + cp[1] + (a0 < bp[0]);
355 a0 = (a0 >> 1) | (a1 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
356 bx ++;
357 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
358 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a1 >> 1);
359 ap[0] = a0 ^ rb;
360 sb = 0; /* since b + c fits on p+1 bits, the sticky bit is zero */
361 }
362 else if (bx > cx)
363 {
364 BGreater2:
365 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
366 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
367 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* 0 < d < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
368 {
369 sb = cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d); /* bits from cp[-1] after shift */
370 a0 = bp[0] + ((cp[1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[0] >> d));
371 a1 = bp[1] + (cp[1] >> d) + (a0 < bp[0]);
372 if (a1 < bp[1]) /* carry in high word */
373 {
374 exponent_shift:
375 sb |= a0 & 1;
376 /* shift a by 1 */
377 a0 = (a1 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (a0 >> 1);
378 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a1 >> 1);
379 bx ++;
380 }
381 else
382 ap[1] = a1;
383 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
384 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
385 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
386 }
387 else if (d < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* GMP_NUMB_BITS <= d < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
388 {
389 sb = (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? cp[0]
390 : cp[0] | (cp[1] << (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS-d));
391 a0 = bp[0] + (cp[1] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS));
392 a1 = bp[1] + (a0 < bp[0]);
393 if (a1 == 0)
394 goto exponent_shift;
395 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
396 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
397 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
398 ap[1] = a1;
399 }
400 else /* d >= 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
401 {
402 ap[0] = bp[0];
403 ap[1] = bp[1];
404 rb = 0; /* since p < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
405 sb = 1; /* since c <> 0 */
406 }
407 }
408 else /* bx < cx: swap b and c */
409 {
410 mpfr_exp_t tx;
411 mp_limb_t *tp;
412 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
413 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
414 goto BGreater2;
415 }
416
417 /* now perform rounding */
418 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx > __gmpfr_emax))
419 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
420
421 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
422 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
423 MPFR_RET(0);
424 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
425 {
426 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
427 goto truncate;
428 else
429 goto add_one_ulp;
430 }
431 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
432 {
433 truncate:
434 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
435 }
436 else /* round away from zero */
437 {
438 add_one_ulp:
439 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
440 ap[1] += (ap[0] == 0);
441 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[1] == 0))
442 {
443 ap[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
444 /* no need to have MPFR_LIKELY here, since we are in a rare branch */
445 if (bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax)
446 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
447 else /* overflow */
448 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
449 }
450 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
451 }
452}
453
454/* same as mpfr_add1sp, but for 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
455static int
456mpfr_add1sp3 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode,
457 mpfr_prec_t p)
458{
459 mpfr_exp_t bx = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
460 mpfr_exp_t cx = MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
461 mp_limb_t *ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
462 mp_limb_t *bp = MPFR_MANT(b);
463 mp_limb_t *cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
464 mpfr_prec_t sh = 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
465 mp_limb_t rb; /* round bit */
466 mp_limb_t sb; /* sticky bit */
467 mp_limb_t a2, a1, a0;
468 mp_limb_t mask;
469 mpfr_uexp_t d;
470
471 MPFR_ASSERTD(2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS);
472
473 if (bx == cx)
474 {
475 /* since bp[2], cp[2] >= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT, a carry always occurs */
476 a0 = bp[0] + cp[0];
477 a1 = bp[1] + cp[1] + (a0 < bp[0]);
478 a2 = bp[2] + cp[2] + (a1 < bp[1] || (a1 == bp[1] && a0 < bp[0]));
479 /* since p < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS, we lose no bit in a0 >> 1 */
480 a0 = (a1 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (a0 >> 1);
481 bx ++;
482 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
483 ap[2] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a2 >> 1);
484 ap[1] = (a2 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (a1 >> 1);
485 ap[0] = a0 ^ rb;
486 sb = 0; /* since b + c fits on p+1 bits, the sticky bit is zero */
487 }
488 else if (bx > cx)
489 {
490 BGreater2:
491 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) bx - cx;
492 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
493 if (d < GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* 0 < d < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
494 {
495 mp_limb_t cy;
496 sb = cp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d); /* bits from cp[-1] after shift */
497 a0 = bp[0] + ((cp[1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[0] >> d));
498 a1 = bp[1] + ((cp[2] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | (cp[1] >> d))
499 + (a0 < bp[0]);
500 cy = a1 < bp[1] || (a1 == bp[1] && a0 < bp[0]); /* carry in a1 */
501 a2 = bp[2] + (cp[2] >> d) + cy;
502 if (a2 < bp[2] || (a2 == bp[2] && cy)) /* carry in high word */
503 {
504 exponent_shift:
505 sb |= a0 & 1;
506 /* shift a by 1 */
507 a0 = (a1 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (a0 >> 1);
508 ap[1] = (a2 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (a1 >> 1);
509 ap[2] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (a2 >> 1);
510 bx ++;
511 }
512 else
513 {
514 ap[1] = a1;
515 ap[2] = a2;
516 }
517 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
518 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
519 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
520 }
521 else if (d < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* GMP_NUMB_BITS <= d < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
522 {
523 mp_limb_t c0shifted;
524 sb = (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? cp[0]
525 : (cp[1] << (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - d)) | cp[0];
526 c0shifted = (d == GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? cp[1]
527 : (cp[2] << (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS-d)) | (cp[1] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS));
528 a0 = bp[0] + c0shifted;
529 a1 = bp[1] + (cp[2] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS)) + (a0 < bp[0]);
530 /* if a1 < bp[1], there was a carry in the above addition,
531 or when a1 = bp[1] and one of the added terms is nonzero
532 (the sum of cp[2] >> (d - GMP_NUMB_BITS) and a0 < bp[0]
533 is at most 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS-d) */
534 a2 = bp[2] + ((a1 < bp[1]) || (a1 == bp[1] && a0 < bp[0]));
535 if (a2 == 0)
536 goto exponent_shift;
537 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
538 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
539 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
540 ap[1] = a1;
541 ap[2] = a2;
542 }
543 else if (d < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS<=d<3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
544 {
545 MPFR_ASSERTD (2*GMP_NUMB_BITS <= d && d < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS);
546 sb = (d == 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS ? 0 : cp[2] << (3*GMP_NUMB_BITS - d))
547 | cp[1] | cp[0];
548 a0 = bp[0] + (cp[2] >> (d - 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS));
549 a1 = bp[1] + (a0 < bp[0]);
550 a2 = bp[2] + (a1 < bp[1]);
551 if (a2 == 0)
552 goto exponent_shift;
553 rb = a0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
554 sb |= (a0 & mask) ^ rb;
555 ap[0] = a0 & ~mask;
556 ap[1] = a1;
557 ap[2] = a2;
558 }
559 else /* d >= 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
560 {
561 ap[0] = bp[0];
562 ap[1] = bp[1];
563 ap[2] = bp[2];
564 rb = 0; /* since p < 3*GMP_NUMB_BITS */
565 sb = 1; /* since c <> 0 */
566 }
567 }
568 else /* bx < cx: swap b and c */
569 {
570 mpfr_exp_t tx;
571 mp_limb_t *tp;
572 tx = bx; bx = cx; cx = tx;
573 tp = bp; bp = cp; cp = tp;
574 goto BGreater2;
575 }
576
577 /* now perform rounding */
578 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx > __gmpfr_emax))
579 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
580
581 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
582 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
583 MPFR_RET(0);
584 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
585 {
586 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
587 goto truncate;
588 else
589 goto add_one_ulp;
590 }
591 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
592 {
593 truncate:
594 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(a));
595 }
596 else /* round away from zero */
597 {
598 add_one_ulp:
599 ap[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
600 ap[1] += (ap[0] == 0);
601 ap[2] += (ap[1] == 0 && ap[0] == 0);
602 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(ap[2] == 0))
603 {
604 ap[2] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
605 /* no need to have MPFR_LIKELY here, since we are in a rare branch */
606 if (bx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax)
607 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx + 1);
608 else /* overflow */
609 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
610 }
611 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(a));
612 }
613}
614
615#endif /* !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) */
616
617/* compute sign(b) * (|b| + |c|).
618 Returns 0 iff result is exact,
619 a negative value when the result is less than the exact value,
620 a positive value otherwise. */
621MPFR_HOT_FUNCTION_ATTR int
622mpfr_add1sp (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
623{
624 mpfr_uexp_t d;
625 mpfr_prec_t p;
626 unsigned int sh;
627 mp_size_t n;
628 mp_limb_t *ap, *cp;
629 mpfr_exp_t bx;
630 mp_limb_t limb;
631 int inexact;
632 int neg;
633 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
634
635 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
636
637 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(a) == MPFR_PREC(b) && MPFR_PREC(b) == MPFR_PREC(c));
638 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_PURE_FP(b));
639 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_PURE_FP(c));
640
641 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a, b);
642
643 /* Read prec and num of limbs */
644 p = MPFR_GET_PREC (b);
645
646#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI)
647 if (p < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
648 return mpfr_add1sp1 (a, b, c, rnd_mode, p);
649
650 if (GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
651 return mpfr_add1sp2 (a, b, c, rnd_mode, p);
652
653 /* we put this test after the mpfr_add1sp2() call, to avoid slowing down
654 the more frequent case GMP_NUMB_BITS < p < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS */
655 if (p == GMP_NUMB_BITS)
656 return mpfr_add1sp1n (a, b, c, rnd_mode);
657
658 if (2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS < p && p < 3 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
659 return mpfr_add1sp3 (a, b, c, rnd_mode, p);
660#endif
661
662 /* We need to get the sign before the possible exchange. */
663 neg = MPFR_IS_NEG (b);
664
665 bx = MPFR_GET_EXP(b);
666 if (bx < MPFR_GET_EXP(c))
667 {
668 mpfr_srcptr t = b;
669 bx = MPFR_GET_EXP(c);
670 b = c;
671 c = t;
672 }
673 MPFR_ASSERTD(bx >= MPFR_GET_EXP(c));
674
675 n = MPFR_PREC2LIMBS (p);
676 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(sh, p);
677 d = (mpfr_uexp_t) (bx - MPFR_GET_EXP(c));
678
679 /* printf ("New add1sp with diff=%lu\n", (unsigned long) d); */
680
681 if (d == 0)
682 {
683 /* d==0 */
684 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("C= ", MPFR_MANT(c), p); */
685 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("B= ", MPFR_MANT(b), p); */
686 bx++; /* exp + 1 */
687 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
688 limb = mpn_add_n (ap, MPFR_MANT(b), MPFR_MANT(c), n);
689 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("A= ", ap, p); */
690 MPFR_ASSERTD(limb != 0); /* There must be a carry */
691 limb = ap[0]; /* Get LSB (In fact, LSW) */
692 mpn_rshift (ap, ap, n, 1); /* Shift mantissa A */
693 ap[n-1] |= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT; /* Set MSB */
694 ap[0] &= ~MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh); /* Clear LSB bit */
695
696
697 /* Fast track for faithful rounding: since b and c have the same
698 precision and the same exponent, the neglected value is either
699 0 or 1/2 ulp(a), thus returning a is fine. */
700 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
701 { inexact = 0; goto set_exponent; }
702
703 if ((limb & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0) /* Check exact case */
704 { inexact = 0; goto set_exponent; }
705
706 /* Zero: Truncate
707 Nearest: Even Rule => truncate or add 1
708 Away: Add 1 */
709 if (MPFR_LIKELY (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN))
710 {
711 if ((ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0)
712 { inexact = -1; goto set_exponent; }
713 else
714 goto add_one_ulp;
715 }
716 MPFR_UPDATE_RND_MODE(rnd_mode, neg);
717 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
718 { inexact = -1; goto set_exponent; }
719 else
720 goto add_one_ulp;
721 }
722 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (d >= p))
723 {
724 /* fast track for RNDF */
725 if (MPFR_LIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF))
726 goto copy_set_exponent;
727
728 if (MPFR_LIKELY (d > p))
729 {
730 /* d > p : Copy B in A */
731 /* Away: Add 1
732 Nearest: Trunc
733 Zero: Trunc */
734 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN || MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ (rnd_mode, neg))
735 {
736 copy_set_exponent:
737 ap = MPFR_MANT (a);
738 MPN_COPY (ap, MPFR_MANT(b), n);
739 inexact = -1;
740 goto set_exponent;
741 }
742 else
743 {
744 copy_add_one_ulp:
745 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
746 MPN_COPY (ap, MPFR_MANT(b), n);
747 goto add_one_ulp;
748 }
749 }
750 else
751 {
752 /* d==p : Copy B in A */
753 /* Away: Add 1
754 Nearest: Even Rule if C is a power of 2, else Add 1
755 Zero: Trunc */
756 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
757 {
758 /* Check if C was a power of 2 */
759 cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
760 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (cp[n-1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
761 {
762 mp_size_t k = n-1;
763 do
764 k--;
765 while (k >= 0 && cp[k] == 0);
766 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (k < 0))
767 /* Power of 2: Even rule */
768 if (((MPFR_MANT (b))[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0)
769 goto copy_set_exponent;
770 }
771 /* Not a Power of 2 */
772 goto copy_add_one_ulp;
773 }
774 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ (rnd_mode, neg))
775 goto copy_set_exponent;
776 else
777 goto copy_add_one_ulp;
778 }
779 }
780 else /* 0 < d < p */
781 {
782 mp_limb_t mask;
783 mp_limb_t bcp, bcp1; /* Cp and C'p+1 */
784
785 /* General case: 1 <= d < p */
786 cp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n);
787
788 /* Shift c in temporary allocated place */
789 {
790 mpfr_uexp_t dm;
791 mp_size_t m;
792
793 dm = d % GMP_NUMB_BITS;
794 m = d / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
795 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (dm == 0))
796 {
797 /* dm = 0 and m > 0: Just copy */
798 MPFR_ASSERTD (m != 0);
799 MPN_COPY(cp, MPFR_MANT(c)+m, n-m);
800 MPN_ZERO(cp+n-m, m);
801 }
802 else if (MPFR_LIKELY(m == 0))
803 {
804 /* dm >=1 and m == 0: just shift */
805 MPFR_ASSERTD(dm >= 1);
806 mpn_rshift(cp, MPFR_MANT(c), n, dm);
807 }
808 else
809 {
810 /* dm > 0 and m > 0: shift and zero */
811 mpn_rshift(cp, MPFR_MANT(c)+m, n-m, dm);
812 MPN_ZERO(cp+n-m, m);
813 }
814 }
815
816 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("Before", MPFR_MANT(c), p);
817 mpfr_print_mant_binary("B= ", MPFR_MANT(b), p);
818 mpfr_print_mant_binary("After ", cp, p); */
819
820 /* fast track for RNDF */
821 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
822 {
823 /* The bcp and bcp1 values will not matter for MPFR_RNDF, but
824 let's set them to 0 to avoid undefined behavior. */
825 bcp1 = bcp = 0;
826 goto clean;
827 }
828
829 /* Compute bcp=Cp and bcp1=C'p+1: bcp is the first neglected bit
830 (round bit), and bcp1 corresponds to the remaining bits (sticky bit).
831 */
832 if (sh > 0)
833 {
834 /* Try to compute them from C' rather than C */
835 bcp = (cp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<(sh-1)));
836 if (MPFR_LIKELY (cp[0] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK (sh - 1)))
837 bcp1 = 1;
838 else
839 {
840 /* We can't compute C'p+1 from C'. Compute it from C */
841 /* Start from bit x=p-d+sh in mantissa C
842 (+sh since we have already looked sh bits in C'!) */
843 mpfr_prec_t x = p - d + sh - 1;
844 if (MPFR_LIKELY (x > p))
845 /* We are already looked at all the bits of c, so C'p+1 = 0*/
846 bcp1 = 0;
847 else
848 {
849 mp_limb_t *tp = MPFR_MANT(c);
850 mp_size_t kx = n - 1 - (x / GMP_NUMB_BITS);
851 mpfr_prec_t sx = GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1 - (x % GMP_NUMB_BITS);
852 /* printf ("(First) x=%lu Kx=%ld Sx=%lu\n",
853 (unsigned long) x, (long) kx, (unsigned long) sx); */
854 /* Looks at the last bits of limb kx (if sx=0 does nothing)*/
855 if (tp[kx] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sx))
856 bcp1 = 1;
857 else
858 {
859 /*kx += (sx==0);*/
860 /*If sx==0, tp[kx] hasn't been checked*/
861 do
862 kx--;
863 while (kx >= 0 && tp[kx] == 0);
864 bcp1 = (kx >= 0);
865 }
866 }
867 }
868 }
869 else /* sh == 0 */
870 {
871 /* Compute Cp and C'p+1 from C with sh=0 */
872 mp_limb_t *tp = MPFR_MANT(c);
873 /* Start from bit x=p-d in mantissa C */
874 mpfr_prec_t x = p - d;
875 mp_size_t kx = n - 1 - (x / GMP_NUMB_BITS);
876 mpfr_prec_t sx = GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1 - (x % GMP_NUMB_BITS);
877 MPFR_ASSERTD (p >= d);
878 bcp = tp[kx] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sx);
879 /* Looks at the last bits of limb kx (If sx=0, does nothing)*/
880 if (tp[kx] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sx))
881 bcp1 = 1;
882 else
883 {
884 do
885 kx--;
886 while (kx >= 0 && tp[kx] == 0);
887 bcp1 = (kx >= 0);
888 }
889 }
890 /* printf("sh=%u Cp=%lu C'p+1=%lu\n", sh,
891 (unsigned long) bcp, (unsigned long) bcp1); */
892
893 clean:
894 /* Clean shifted C' */
895 mask = ~MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
896 cp[0] &= mask;
897
898 /* Add the mantissa c from b in a */
899 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
900 limb = mpn_add_n (ap, MPFR_MANT(b), cp, n);
901 /* mpfr_print_mant_binary("Add= ", ap, p); */
902
903 /* Check for overflow */
904 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (limb))
905 {
906 limb = ap[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<sh); /* Get LSB */
907 mpn_rshift (ap, ap, n, 1); /* Shift mantissa */
908 bx++; /* Fix exponent */
909 ap[n-1] |= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT; /* Set MSB */
910 ap[0] &= mask; /* Clear LSB bit */
911 bcp1 |= bcp; /* Recompute C'p+1 */
912 bcp = limb; /* Recompute Cp */
913 /* printf ("(Overflow) Cp=%lu C'p+1=%lu\n",
914 (unsigned long) bcp, (unsigned long) bcp1);
915 mpfr_print_mant_binary ("Add= ", ap, p); */
916 }
917
918 /* Round:
919 Zero: Truncate but could be exact.
920 Away: Add 1 if Cp or C'p+1 !=0
921 Nearest: Truncate but could be exact if Cp==0
922 Add 1 if C'p+1 !=0,
923 Even rule else */
924 if (MPFR_LIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF))
925 { inexact = 0; goto set_exponent; }
926 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
927 {
928 inexact = - (bcp1 != 0);
929 if (bcp == 0)
930 goto set_exponent;
931 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bcp1==0) && (ap[0]&(MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<sh))==0)
932 { inexact = -1; goto set_exponent; }
933 else
934 goto add_one_ulp;
935 }
936 MPFR_UPDATE_RND_MODE(rnd_mode, neg);
937 inexact = -(bcp != 0 || bcp1 != 0);
938 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ || inexact == 0)
939 goto set_exponent;
940 else
941 goto add_one_ulp;
942 }
943 MPFR_RET_NEVER_GO_HERE();
944
945 add_one_ulp:
946 /* add one unit in last place to a */
947 /* printf("AddOneUlp\n"); */
948 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY( mpn_add_1(ap, ap, n, MPFR_LIMB_ONE<<sh) ))
949 {
950 /* Case 100000x0 = 0x1111x1 + 1*/
951 /* printf("Pow of 2\n"); */
952 bx++;
953 ap[n-1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
954 }
955 inexact = 1;
956
957 set_exponent:
958 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(bx > __gmpfr_emax)) /* Check for overflow */
959 {
960 /* printf("Overflow\n"); */
961 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
962 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
963 }
964 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, bx);
965
966 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
967 MPFR_RET (inexact * MPFR_INT_SIGN (a));
968}
969
